subject: Change generic signature of assert that
msgSnippet: Consider the following case: Map result = null; assertThat(result, hasEntry( Key , java.util.Date.class)); This will not
messageBody:
Consider the following case:

Map<String, Class<? extends Serializable>> result = null;

assertThat(result, hasEntry("Key", java.util.Date.class));

This will not compile, but if the method signature of assertThat was changed to:

public static <T> void assertThat(T actual, Matcher<? extends T> matcher)

It would compile.

I would seem that it would be an appropriate change for such cases (unless there is something I don't understand about the deep implications of Generics).

What do you think?

Yishai
